hanzi-su-wiki:
帆

Значения

Парус

Мнемоника

Матерчатый 巾 парус, надуваемый ветром — дыханием вселенной 凡.

Варианты

㠶, 䑺
purpleculture_pinyin:
fān
sail; Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布 [fan1 bu4] canvas; to gallop; Taiwan pr. [fan2]; variant of 帆 [fan1]
плыть; Тайвань пр. [fan2], кроме 帆布 [fan1 bu4] холст; скакать; Тайвань пр. [fan2]; вариант 帆 [fan1]
rtega_mnemonic:
帆帆RSsail, boat
  • sail 凡 made of cloth 巾 for a boat
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 颿)
Pictophonetic: 凡 indicates the sound; 巾 (cloth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
一帆风顺 [ yī fān fēng shùn ]: propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom); plain sailing; to go smoothly; have a nice trip!
帆船 [ fān chuán ]: sailboat
帆布 [ fān bù ]: canvas; sailcloth
风帆 [ fēng fān ]: sail; sailing boat
扬帆 [ yáng fān ]: to set sail
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 巾 [ jīn ] cloth, curtain, handkerchief, towel
    • 凡 [ fán ] any, every, all; common, ordinary
heisig_chinese_memo: An ordinary towel doesn't make a good sail, but it's better than nothing!
heisig_story: A sail made of a towel makes a mediocre vessel.
koohiiStory1: When stranded at sea, we needed a Sail. The best we had was a TOWEL, which was MEDICORE, only catching a DROP of WIND.
koohiiStory2: A towel makes a mediocre sail.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You hoist your towel above your table, drop into the water and sail away. You turned the towel into an actual sail and you're balancing on top of the table, which is now a boat.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine sailing out into the open sea, drops of water hitting your face, as the towel sail catches the air and carries you away.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you sail off into the ocean you hear a familiar voice shout out, "Ahoy!" Han (はん) Solo calls. He's also got a towel sail, but it's on the Millennium Falcon, which is half-submerged in the water.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You sail nervously past Han Solo who also seems to be sailing, though in worse shape than you. But he keeps throwing you finger guns so you figure it's best to just sail on and pretend this never happened.
Ru_trainchinese: fān: (сущ) парус; (книжн.) парусное судно, парусник
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a turban (巾) can make a simple (凡) sail
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An ordinary towel doesn't make a good sail, but it's better than nothing!
humanum_full_description_en:
From " scarf " to " fan " sound. The original meaning is the use of wind to make the ship move forward, hung on the mast. "Guang Yun. "Fan Yun": "Sail, the upper mantle of the boat." For example, Cao Pi of the Three Kingdoms "Fuhuai Fu": "So the wind is frightened and the waves are horrified. Three Kingdoms. Wu Shu. "Ding Feng Chuan": "When the wind is north, the sail will arrive on the second day, and then it will occupy Xutang.

" Sail " also means sailing. Such as "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Passing Shi Ningshu": "Cut the bamboos to guard the sea, and sail in vain over the old mountains." Liu Yuxi of the Tang Dynasty "See you at the first meeting of the first meeting in Yangzhou for the lottery": "Thousands of sails pass by the side of the sunken boat, and thousands of trees are in front of the sick tree. spring."

" Fan " also means that Zhang Fan is driving. "Release name. "Shi Chuan": "Open the mantle with the wind to say the sail, the sail, the fan also makes the boat swift and panic." For example, Han Yu of the Tang Dynasty "Delivered to Eyue Doctor Li from Jiangzhou to Jiangzhou": "It's not worth the old man's book, no reason Fan Jiang water."
humanum_short_description_en: From " scarf " to " fan " sound. The original meaning is the use of wind to make the ship move forward, hung on the mast.
humanum_full_description:
從「巾」，「凡」聲。本義是利用風力使船前進的布篷，掛在船桅上。《廣韻．凡韻》：「帆，船上幔也。」如三國魏曹丕〈浮淮賦〉：「于是驚風泛，涌波駭，眾帆張，群櫂起，爭先遂進，莫適相待。」《三國志．吳書．丁奉傳》：「時北風，奉舉帆二日至，遂據徐塘。」

　　「帆」也表示帆船。如《文選．謝靈運〈過始寧墅〉》：「剖竹守滄海，枉帆過舊山。」唐代劉禹錫〈酬樂天揚州初逢席上見贈〉：「沉舟側畔千帆過，病樹前頭萬木春。」

　　「帆」還表示張帆行駛。《釋名．釋船》：「隨風張幔曰帆，帆，泛也，使舟疾汎汎然也。」如唐代韓愈〈除官越闕至江州寄鄂岳李大夫〉：「不枉故人書，無因帆江水。」
humanum_short_description: 從「巾」，「凡」聲。本義是利用風力使船前進的布篷，掛在船桅上。

Total strokes: 6; Radical: 巾

    • 凡 [ fán ] any, every, all; common, ordinary

從「 巾 」，「 凡 」聲。本義是利用風力使船前進的布篷，掛在船桅上。《廣韻．凡韻》：「帆，船上幔也。」如三國魏曹丕〈浮淮賦〉：「于是驚風泛，涌波駭，眾帆張，群櫂起，爭先遂進，莫適相待。」《三國志．吳書．丁奉傳》：「時北風，奉舉帆二日至，遂據徐塘。」 「 帆 」也表示帆船。如《文選．謝靈運〈過始寧墅〉》：「剖竹守滄海，枉帆過舊山。」唐代劉禹錫〈酬樂天揚州初逢席上見贈〉：「沉舟側畔千帆過，病樹前頭萬木春。」 「 帆 」還表示張帆行駛。《釋名．釋船》：「隨風張幔曰帆，帆，泛也，使舟疾汎汎然也。」如唐代韓愈〈除官越闕至江州寄鄂岳李大夫〉：「不枉故人書，無因帆江水。」

For example, Cao Pi of the Three Kingdoms "Fuhuai Fu": "So the wind is frightened and the waves are horrified. Three Kingdoms. Wu Shu. "Ding Feng Chuan": "When the wind is north, the sail will arrive on the second day, and then it will occupy Xutang. " Sail" also means sailing. Such as "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Passing Shi Ningshu": "Cut the bamboos to guard the sea, and sail in vain over the old mountains." Liu Yuxi of the Tang Dynasty "See you at the first meeting of the first meeting in Yangzhou for the lottery": "Thousands of sails pass by the side of the sunken boat, and thousands of trees are in front of the sick tree. spring." " Fan" also means that Zhang Fan is driving. "Release name. "Shi Chuan": "Open the mantle with the wind to say the sail, the sail, the fan also makes the boat swift and panic." For example, Han Yu of the Tang Dynasty "Delivered to Eyue Doctor Li from Jiangzhou to Jiangzhou": "It's not worth the old man's book, no reason Fan Jiang water."

Name meaning
: A canopy that uses wind to move the ship forward.
fān
1) парус; под парусами, на парусной лодке
张帆 распустить (поднять) паруса
帆归 вернуться домой на парусной лодке
2) поднимать паруса; идти под парусами
帆江水 плыть под парусами по реке
Radicals: 巾, 几, 丶  (towel, table, drop)
Meaning Mnemonic
You hoist your towel above your table, drop into the water and sail away. You turned the towel into an actual sail and you're balancing on top of the table, which is now a boat.
Imagine sailing out into the open sea, drops of water hitting your face, as the towel sail catches the air and carries you away.
Reading Mnemonic
As you sail off into the ocean you hear a familiar voice shout out, "Ahoy!" Han (はん) Solo calls. He's also got a towel sail, but it's on the Millennium Falcon, which is half-submerged in the water.
You sail nervously past Han Solo who also seems to be sailing, though in worse shape than you. But he keeps throwing you finger guns so you figure it's best to just sail on and pretend this never happened.
